intro: Oncostemum subcuspidatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with a pointed tip. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small umbels, and are borne on short pedicels. Oncostemum subcuspidatum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along streambanks.
